data.title: John D. Moede Bio – Sherwood Forest Estates Fire District AZ
data.text:
John served 28 years with the Los Angeles City Fire Department (LAFD) where he retired in 2010 with the rank of Captain. John’s LAFD assignments included field operations as a Firefighter/Paramedic and Captain, and administrative assignments such as Internal Affairs and the Emergency Medical Services Section. One of his assignments with the LAFD was with the Disaster Preparedness Division (1988) where he played a role in the development and initiation of the Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) program. He also played a role in the development of the Department’s Urban Search and Rescue Team. This assignment led him to be deployed to the San Francisco Bay area in 1989 after the Loma Prieta earthquake as a member of the Department’s 4 person Assist and Document Team.

John then served with the City of Scottsdale, AZ for five years (2010 – 2015) as the Emergency Management Coordinator. John was tasked with developing, coordinating, and implementing Emergency Management projects such as the development of the Emergency Operations Center (EOC), the Emergency Operations Plan (EOP), Incident Management Teams, and the City of Scottsdale’s CERT program. John was part of the City of Scottsdale Area Command Team for the Waste Management Open/Super Bowl 49 Event, January 23 – February 2, 2015.

John is a graduate of the Fire Service Chief Executive Officer program from Mays Business School at Texas A&M (May 2018). John is also a graduate of the Naval Post Graduate School’s Executive Leaders Program (ELP 12-02) and of Federal Emergency Management Agency’s (FEMA) Emergency Management Leaders Academy (Cohort 1). John has served on FEMA’s National Urban Search and Rescue (US&R) Medical Criteria Committee, Document and Technical Review Panel, and served as a part of FEMA’s Technical Support Team following the Hurricane Emily event of 1993. John has been an adjunct instructor for the California Specialized Training Institute, the Emergency Management Institute, and the Arizona Division of Emergency Management.

John has a special interest in disaster response and planning. His publications include “Medical Aspects of Urban Search and Rescue” (Moede JD: Medical aspects of urban heavy rescue. Prehosp Disaster Med 1991;6(3):341-345) and “Management of Spontaneous Volunteers” (Moede, JD. Management of spontaneous volunteers. Response Magazine;1993;(12):13-16). He has lectured frequently on these issues and was one of three Americans invited to Germany in 1993 at the Canada/Germany sponsored seminar on Civil Emergency Preparedness for Central and Eastern European (CEE) States and Countries of the former Soviet Union.

John recently retired, after 7 years, as a Firefighter for the Williams Volunteer Fire Department (AZ). His duties as a Support Member, Firefighter and Assistant Chief included emergency response, strategic plan development, member training and apparatus and facilities maintenance. John is currently a member of the Arizona LAST (Local Assistance State Team) which provides support to fire departments following line of duty, non line of duty and retiree deaths.
